intro: Boehmeria longifolia, commonly known as Chinese nettle or longleaf mulberry, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its fibrous stems are valued for their use in traditional textiles and papermaking. Boehmeria longifolia also has medicinal uses in traditional Chinese medicine.
